habitat_improvements_streams.Details: BLM led project to improve trout habitat by increasing pool quality/quantity and installing woody debris
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, planting native riparian vegetation, and improving access with new parking areas
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, planting native riparian vegetation, and improving access with new trails and bridges
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, planting native riparian vegetation, and improving access with new trails and bridges
Improved trout habitat by creating rock structure pools, off channel pools, and planting native riparian vegetation and constructing new boat ramp
Improve trout habitat by excavating pools and renovating historic braid channels
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structures pools, off channel wetlands for wildlife, and constructing new boat ramps
Improved trout habitat by creating rock structure pools, off channel pools, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improving overwintering habitat for Rio Grande cutthroat and other native fish species by creating low flow channel shaping and rock structure pools
Improved trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installing woody debris, and planting native riparian vegetation
Improved Gila trout habitat by creating low flow channel, rock structure pools, installed woody debris, and planint native riparian vegetation
Improved overwintering habitat for Rio Grande cuthroat trout and other native fish speices by creating low flow channel and installing rock structure pools

habitat_improvements_lakes.Details: Improved habitat for largemouth bass, channel catfish, trout, and sunfish by installing multiple spawning and cover structures and woody debris

metadata.source: NM Game & Fish ArcGIS Feature Service
